brief_summary.textblock:
Palatability testing of 3 different formulations of a newly developed paediatric
      valacyclovir oral solution in children 4-12 years of age and at least one of their parents.
      Children will be included, who received (val)acyclovir prophylaxis in the past, or will
      probably need it in the future i.e. children with primary immune deficiency or cancer.

clinical_study.brief_title: Palatability Testing of a New Paediatric Formulation of Valacyclovir - VALID 0

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject is at least 4 years of age.

          -  Subject weighs at least 15kg.

          -  Subject is capable of performing the taste assessment, according to the
             investigator's judgement.

          -  The child and parent(s) are willing to participate in the taste assessment.

          -  Signed informed consent by the legal guardian for participation of the child and if
             the parent also wants to participate: signed informed consent for their own
             participation, prior to start of the study.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Documented history of sensitivity/idiosyncrasy to medicinal products or excipients.

          -  Presence of any condition that influences taste sensation (such as upper respiratory
             infection, febrile illness within 3 days before the first dose, mucositis or use of
             medication that influences taste perception, as described in the label information).

intervention.description: Children of 4-8 years will taste 2 ml of each solution and children of 8-12 years and the parent(s) will taste 4 ml of each solution.

clinical_study.official_title: Palatability Testing of a New Paediatric Formulation of Valacyclovir for the Prophylaxis and Treatment of VZV and HSV Infections in Children - VALID 0

oversight_info.authority: Netherlands: Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport

primary_outcome.description: Patients (children) will assess the taste of 3 different oral solutions. A questionnaire has to be completed to order the palatability of the three formulations.
primary_outcome.measure: Selection of oral solution with best taste

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Children will score the taste of 3 different oral valacyclovir solutions. A 100 mm facial hedonic scale will be employed to indicate the palatability of each formulation.
To determine whether parents can predict the palatability preference of their child.
secondary_outcome.measure: Predictability of palatability preference of the child by parents.

collaborator.agency: ZonMw: The Netherlands Organisation for Health Research and Development

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
